PSNow was very forward thinking and it can be a great service.

Sony is every bit as creative as any game company and we need them

I accidentally paid for a month of #PlaystationNow and it is horrible!! Don’t buy it! 
1. Controller lag is horrid, even with high net speeds.
2. It eats data like a pig.
3. Playing anything multiplayer on top of that is next to impossible.
4. LAN connection required.

Contents: @xLEAMGx PSNow allows streaming PS2,3&4 select games to a PC or Vita for ~$20 a month even if you already own the games. XCloud allows streaming games you own or buy to phones, tablets and a PC for no subscription fee, but would most likely require a standard Xbox Live account.
Author: @Colteastwood
Name: colteastwood
Post Title:
@xLEAMGx PSNow allows streaming PS2,3&4 select games to a PC or Vita for ~$20 a month even if you already own the games.

XCloud allows streaming games you own or buy to phones, tablets and a PC for no subscription fee, but would most likely require a standard Xbox Live account.

Contents: I'm so glad you love the pacing! It's very hard to separate the writer's work from the director's. When we write the scripts, we try to give a sense of rhythm, but it's always up to the directors and actors to actualize. Sometimes scenes we picture going very quickly go more 1/2

Name: Sony
Post Title: I'm so glad you love the pacing! It's very hard to separate the writer's work from the director's. When we write the scripts, we try to give a sense of rhythm, but it's always up to the directors and actors to actualize. Sometimes scenes we picture going very quickly go more 1/2

Contents: So many people see game streaming as the next revolution in games. Well, if that's the case, why isn't PlayStation Now thriving? (And yes, cutting it down to working only on PS4 and PC didn't help. Neither do the high enrollment fees.)

Name: Robert “The DCD" Wolf-man
Post Title:
So many people see game streaming as the next revolution in games. Well, if that's the case, why isn't PlayStation Now thriving?

(And yes, cutting it down to working only on PS4 and PC didn't help. Neither do the high enrollment fees.)
